node.title: Powerball Results, Numbers for 11/6/21: Did Anyone Win the $146M Jackpot?
node.alt: A customer holds a handful of Powerball tickets at Kavanagh Liquors on January 13, 2016 in San Lorenzo, California
node.description: The Powerball numbers on Saturday were 8, 30, 48, 57 and 64. The Powerball was 9 and the Power Play was 2X.
node.content:
["The Powerball numbers on Saturday were 8, 30, 48, 57 and 64. The Powerball was 9 and the Power Play was 2X.", "But no one won the $146 million jackpot in the November 6 drawing, meaning the top prize will now rise to an estimated $151 million (with a cash value of $109.1 million) for Monday's drawing.", "Although the jackpot wasn't won, there were some big winners.", "A player from Florida and another from Washington won $2 million prizes after correctly matched five white balls and purchasing a Power Play.", "Thirteen players matched four white balls and the Powerball to win $50,000 each and another seven players doubled their winnings to $100,000 with the Power Play.", "", "
A customer holds a handful of Powerball tickets at Kavanagh Liquors on January 13, 2016 in San Lorenzo, California
", "The Powerball jackpot was last won in October when a player from California scooped a prize worth almost $700 million, the fifth-largest in Powerball history. The player had the choice between receiving an estimated annuity of $699.8 million, paid in 30 graduated payments over 29 years, or a lump-sum payment of $496 million.", "The winning ticket was purchased at Albertsons in Morro Bay. That retailer will receive a maximum bonus of $1 million for selling the winning ticket, according to the Powerball website.", "The win was the 41st drawing in the jackpot run, rolling over steadily for four months since a player from Florida scooped a $268 million jackpot in June. Before that, the jackpot had not been claimed since March 27 when another player from Florida scooped a $238 million prize.", "
How to play Powerball
", "Powerball tickets are $2 per play, with players selecting five numbers from 1 to 69, in addition to one red Powerball number from 1 to 26. In certain circumstances, players can also multiply non-jackpot prizes by using the Power Play option for an additional $1.", "Tickets are sold in 45 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands.", "Powerball drawings are broadcast live every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday at 10:59 p.m. ET from the lottery studio located in Tallahassee, Florida.", "Jackpot winners may choose to receive their prize as an annuity, paid in 30 graduated payments over 29 years, or a lump sum payment. Both advertised prize options are prior to federal and jurisdictional taxes.", "The overall odds of winning a prize are 1 in 24.9, according to the Powerball websites. The odds of winning the jackpot are 1 in 292.2 million.", "If you do win a Powerball jackpot, call lottery officials at 1-800-222-0996."]
